intro: Acioa dewevrei var. vanhouttei, commonly known as the Vanhoutte's acioa, is a rare and lesser-known plant species native to specific regions in Central Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats within tropical rainforests. Its botanical features include a woody stem and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
